comment:
* A buffered input stream for a subprocess pipe file descriptor
     * that allows the underlying file descriptor to be reclaimed when
     * the process exits, via the processExited hook.
     *
     * This is tricky because we do not want the user-level InputStream to be
     * closed until the user invokes close(), and we need to continue to be
     * able to read any buffered data lingering in the OS pipe buffer.

methods.name: private static byte[] drainInputStream(InputStream in) throws IOException
synchronized void processExited()
methods.comment: Called by the process reaper thread when the process exits.

methodNames: private static byte[] drainInputStream(InputStream in) throws IOException
